turns.content: In the context of Windows Active Directory, how to do you move a set of DNs from one AU to another?

To move a set of distinguished names (DNs) from one Active Directory (AD) organizational unit (OU) to another, you can use the Move-ADObject cmdlet in PowerShell. This cmdlet allows you to move an AD object, such as an OU, from one location in the AD directory to another.

Here's an example of how you might use the Move-ADObject cmdlet to move a set of DNs from one OU to another:

1. First, open PowerShell and run the following command to connect to your AD domain:
```
Connect-ADDomain -Server <AD_server_name>
```
2. Next, use the Get-ADObject cmdlet to retrieve the DNs of the OUs that you want to move. You can specify the DNs of the OUs using the `-Filter` parameter. For example, the following command retrieves the DNs of all OUs with a name that starts with "Sales":
```
$sourceOUs = Get-ADObject -Filter 'Name -like "Sales*"' -SearchBase '<DN_of_parent_OU>'
```
3. Once you have the DNs of the source OUs, you can use the Move-ADObject cmdlet to move them to the destination OU. The following command moves the OUs that were retrieved in the previous step to the destination OU with the DN `<DN_of_destination_OU>`:
```
Move-ADObject -Identity $sourceOUs -TargetPath '<DN_of_destination_OU>'
```
After running this command, the OUs with the DNs specified in the `$sourceOUs` variable will be moved from their current location in the AD directory to the destination OU.
Can you do this using Apache directory studio?

Yes, you can use Apache Directory Studio to move a set of distinguished names (DNs) from one organizational unit (OU) to another in an Active Directory (AD) directory. Apache Directory Studio is a free, open-source LDAP browser and directory client that allows you to manage and navigate an AD directory.

To move a set of DNs using Apache Directory Studio, follow these steps:

1. Open Apache Directory Studio and connect to your AD server.
2. In the LDAP Browser view, navigate to the OU that contains the DNs you want to move.
3. Right-click on the OU and select "Move" from the context menu. This will open the "Move Entry" dialog box.
4. In the "Move Entry" dialog box, select the destination OU where you want to move the DNs. You can use the "Browse" button to navigate to the destination OU.
5. Click "Finish" to move the DNs from the source OU to the destination OU.

After moving the DNs, you can verify that they have been moved to the destination OU by navigating to the destination OU in the LDAP Browser view.
